page.title: 06Farming in Clifton
page.content: There are two farms in this area,Clifton Hall and Manor Farm,both small farms.Clifton Hall Farm concentrates on producing food for cattle. Account by Jenny Townsend. "We were taken round the farm.We were told about the crops that were growing.In Park Field we saw winter barley;in Court Field we saw grass.This was to be cut down for hay but wet weather was making this difficult.There was oil seed rape in the lower meadow.When we walked round the farm,we had a picnic in the empty hay barn." Manor Farm uses its land for sheep and cows.Poultry is also kept on this farm. The summer months of 1985 have been very wet in Warwickshire,putting most of the crops back by at least 3 weeks.
